taskAnalysis.title: Analysis
taskAnalysis.aboutAnalysisDesc: Used to provide real-time task data analysis, promote data-driven decision making, ensure information transparency, enhance team collaboration and issue tracking, and improve project development management efficiency. AngusTester provides default analysis templates such as burndown charts, backlog tasks, risk assessment, etc., helping users quickly view dashboards and key performance indicators (KPI), while users can also customize analysis dashboards based on business focus areas.
taskAnalysis.notCreatedYet: Not created yet, click to create

placeholder.inputAnalysisDesc: Enter analysis description, such as analysis purpose, background, etc., maximum 200 characters

messages.confirmUpdateSnapshot: Confirm update snapshot content for analysis 【{name}】?

dataSource.snapshot: Save data snapshot, display snapshot data each time

backlog.title: Backlog
backlog.aboutBacklogDesc: Backlog is a list of pending work items, divided into Product Backlog and Sprint Backlog. It is mainly used to manage and plan team work tasks, containing all work items that need to be completed, whether in the current iteration (Sprint) or future iterations.
backlog.productBacklogDesc: Usually maintained by Product Manager (PM) or Product Owner (PO), it is a dynamic, evolving list of product work items that includes all product-related requirements, features, bug fixes, and technical improvements, ensuring the priority and clarity of each work item.
backlog.sprintBacklogDesc: After the sprint planning meeting, the Product Backlog is decomposed into corresponding iterations according to the plan, or a set of work items selected from the Product Backlog at the beginning of each iteration as sprint tasks, which specifies the work that the team will complete in the current iteration.

messages.deadlineMustBeFuture: Deadline must be a future time

taskHome.taskDescription: Tasks help teams manage and track project tasks, issues, and work progress, improve team collaboration and project delivery efficiency, and ensure projects are completed on time and achieve expected goals.
taskHome.teamWorkDescription: Here you and your team can complete the following work:
taskHome.workItem1: Organize and plan team members to carry out project activities and scheduling through "iterations";
taskHome.workItem2: Assign, confirm and collaborate tasks in a clear responsible manner;
taskHome.workItem3: Report and analyze project health, progress and issue trends.

taskMeeting.title: Meeting
taskMeeting.aboutMeetingDesc: Meetings play a key role in agile frameworks, helping teams continuously improve, increase work efficiency, and ensure projects can flexibly respond to changes through regular communication, feedback, and reflection. Supported meeting types are as follows:
taskMeeting.notAddedYet: You haven't added any meetings yet, immediately
taskMeeting.deleteSuccess: Meeting deleted successfully, you can view deleted meetings in the recycle bin

placeholder.inputLocation: Record meeting location or online meeting link, maximum 100 characters

messages.meetingTypeTip: Specify meeting type for identification and management.

meetingTypes.productGroomingDesc: Confirm the long-term vision and short-term goals of the product, ensuring consistent understanding of product direction across the team. Review and organize the Backlog to ensure its priority and feasibility. Participants include product owner, development team, Scrum Master, and relevant stakeholders (marketing, sales team, etc.).
meetingTypes.sprintPlanningDesc: Determine the work to be completed in the upcoming iteration (Sprint). The product owner presents the product Backlog, the team discusses and estimates these items, and decides the amount of work that can be completed in the iteration. Participants include Scrum Master, product owner, and development team.
meetingTypes.dailyStandupDesc: Display team work progress and remaining workload in real-time, allowing the team and stakeholders to clearly understand the current iteration status, promoting team communication and coordination.
meetingTypes.sprintReviewDesc: Show work completed during the iteration, collect feedback, discuss improvement points and follow-up plans. Update the backlog to reflect new requirements or changes. Participants include the Scrum team and relevant stakeholders (such as customers, management).
meetingTypes.sprintRetrospectiveDesc: Reflect on the iteration process and identify opportunities for improvement. Analyze what was successful and what needs improvement in the iteration process. Develop improvement plans to enhance team work efficiency and collaboration. Participants include the Scrum team (development team, Scrum Master, and product owner).
meetingTypes.otherDesc: Other types of meetings organized by teams in the agile process, such as: technical review meetings, requirement review meetings, release planning meetings, obstacle resolution meetings, team building meetings, etc.

taskSprint.title: Sprint
taskSprint.aboutSprintDesc: Sprints help teams plan and execute work more efficiently, improving team collaboration, flexibility, and adaptability, ensuring projects are delivered on time and meet customer requirements.
taskSprint.aboutSprintDesc2: Through continuous iterative improvement and frequent delivery, teams can continuously improve product quality and customer satisfaction. Main benefits are as follows:
taskSprint.notAddedYet: You haven't added any sprints yet, immediately
taskSprint.scrumAgileProcessDesc: Scrum agile software development framework aims to develop software through iterative and incremental approaches. This method can effectively accelerate product delivery while ensuring that the direction of product development always aligns with user needs and expectations.

benefits.organizeWorkDesc: Break down projects into shorter time cycles (usually 1-4 weeks), set clear short-term goals, making it easier for teams to focus on current tasks.
benefits.enhanceCollaborationDesc: Through sprints, team members with different roles such as development, testing, and design can collaborate closely, solve problems together and complete tasks, promoting cross-functional team cooperation.
benefits.improveTransparencyDesc: Real-time display of team work progress and remaining workload, allowing teams and stakeholders to clearly understand the current sprint status.
benefits.improveFlexibilityDesc: At the end of each sprint, teams can review and evaluate work completion, gather feedback, and make adjustments in the next sprint, quickly responding to changes and improvements.
benefits.improveQualityDesc: At the end of each sprint, teams can deliver a usable product increment, conduct testing and validation, ensuring product stability and quality.
benefits.enhanceSatisfactionDesc: Through short-cycle sprints, teams can frequently deliver work results to customers, obtain timely customer feedback, ensuring product development meets customer needs and expectations.

placeholder.inputAcceptanceCriteria: Clearly define the specific conditions and standards for software product delivery.
placeholder.inputOtherInformation: Other descriptions, such as sprint strategy, risk assessment and management, etc.

messages.deleteSuccess: Sprint deleted successfully, you can view the deleted sprint in the recycle bin

tips.ownerTip: By setting an owner for the sprint, you can clarify responsibilities and rights, better promote task completion and progress control, such as: solving problems, advancing progress, collaborating with team members, etc.
tips.taskPrefixTip: After setting, task names under the sprint will start with this prefix.
tips.workloadAssessmentTip: Specify workload assessment method. Work hours refer to the actual time spent by each person to complete a work task, calculated in hours; Story points are assessment values based on work task volume, comprehensive difficulty, and complexity. Using story points can force teams to subdivide problems in tasks, with flexible and highly agile characteristics, recommended for use.
tips.attachmentTip: Supported formats: "jpg","bmp","png","gif","txt","docx","jpeg","rar","zip","doc","xlsx","xls","pdf"; maximum 10 attachments can be uploaded.
